title: Empathy-Based Mathematics Education Design: A Mobile Microlearning Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of elementary mathematical concepts (fractions, ratios, statistics, etc.)
context.additional_context: Everyday problem-solving learning using smartphones: Applying a design thinking process to community-based real-life math problems

learning_goals: Learners can identify community members' mathematics-related difficulties with 80% accuracy during the empathy stage of the design thinking process
Learners can design three types of learner-tailored microlearning content for mathematics problem-solving based on empathy research findings
Learners can improve the user experience (UX) suitability of designed content to an average of 3.5 or higher on a 4-point Likert scale by incorporating peer feedback

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
